answers.answer: I know from my own scans that with the size and Heterogeneous findings that they may biopsy the solid nodule.Hope it all goes well.Em

Is a second opinion called for or does the following make sense?More bloodwork results -T4  -4.8Free T4 - 1.4T3 uptake - 30.TPO described as excessively high by GP.Saw the Endo - he put me back on Levoxyl, with orders to retest  bloodwork for free T4, TSH, Testosterone (all of them) and DHEA-Sulfate in three weeks, with appt and possible biopsy on complex nodule in four weeks.I was surprised that he was more concerned about the complex nodule and not so much about the solid.  He also indicated that because I was hypo, cancer was less of a concern.  His comments were calming, but they also seemed to differ from what I've reading - but it is also clear that different doctors have multiple approaches/beliefs.Would a second opinion be wise if he decides not to biopsy on Nov 5?

question: Originally presented 2 years ago - aural migraine (moving circles in both eyes - no headache pain) - went for check up - found no eye disease, TSH 19.5, low blood sugar, 5 hour blood sugar tests maxed at 90, low at 45.  Treated with diet for pre-diabetes, Synthryoid - moved TSH down to 5, glucose back to normal.  Never felt normal with treatment, stopped for one year, now with presenting symptoms:Thyroid Ultrasound results:Right thyroid lobe measures 5.2cm x 2.3cm x 1.7cm.  It is heterogeneous echotexture.  Within the inferior pole, a hypoechoic 8 mm x 4.7cm solid nodule is seen.Isthmus measures 6mm in thickness.The left thyroid lobe measures 6.1cm x 2cm x 1.9cm.  In the lower pole of the left throid lobe, a complex 1.2cm x 1.1cm nodule with no appreciable flow is seen.Impression:Heterogeneous enlarged thyroid gland compatible with thyroiditis or goiter.Right inferior pole 9 mm solid nodule.Lef thyroid inferior pole complex 1.3cm noduleTSH:  12.5Glucose: 90What does this mean?
title: Thyroid Ultrasound
